revised_title: A Detailed Description of a Remarkable Meteor Seen at Oxford
tldr: The author, John Swinton, describes a remarkable meteor observed in Oxford in 1760. The meteor appeared as a dark column extending towards the zenith, with a pale yellow hue and rugged edges. It temporarily obscured the moon and was likely a water spout. The event made a significant impression on the local population, and a storm of rain and hail followed the next morning.
